metadata.purpose: Key expressions + ready-to-use sentence starters for Cambridge B2 (FCE) essays, written in a clear teen-friendly style
metadata.audience: Teenagers preparing for Cambridge B2 First (FCE)
metadata.source: Selected and adapted from the provided essay-structure slides + template JSON (for_and_against, problems_solutions, cause_effect, agree_disagree, opinion, trends)
design_notes: Keeps the same 'structures → sections → phrases' format as your last JSON file
Removes overly formal/obtrusive lines (e.g. 'vitally important', 'indisputably', 'in all certainty')
Focuses on high-value exam phrases: thesis, paragraph openers, linking, contrast, examples, and conclusions
Phrases are short, flexible, and easy to personalise with [brackets]

for_and_against.title: For & Against (Advantages / Disadvantages)
for_and_against.purpose: Discuss both sides clearly and finish with a balanced conclusion

introduction_context.label: Introduction - Topic Context
introduction_context.purpose: Introduce the topic in a natural way (1–2 sentences)
phrases: Nowadays, [topic] is a common part of everyday life.
These days, more and more people are talking about [topic].
In recent years, [topic] has become an important issue in society.
There is a lot of debate about whether [topic] is mainly positive or negative.
It is often said that [topic] has changed the way people live.

thesis_statement.label: Thesis (Last line of the introduction)
thesis_statement.purpose: Say you will look at both sides
phrases: This essay will discuss the main advantages and disadvantages of [topic].
In this essay, I will consider the benefits as well as the drawbacks of [topic].
The following paragraphs will look at both sides of [topic] before reaching a conclusion.
To form a balanced view, it is useful to examine both the pros and cons of [topic].

arguments_for.label: Body Paragraph A - Advantages
phrases: One clear advantage of [topic] is that it...
A major benefit is that [topic] allows people to...
Another positive point is that [topic] can help to...
This is especially useful for [group] because...
For example, [example] shows how [topic] can...
As a result, [positive result] can be achieved.

transition_to_against.label: Bridge (Move to disadvantages)
phrases: However, there are also some downsides to consider.
That said, [topic] is not perfect.
On the other hand, some people point out that...
Even though [topic] has benefits, it can also cause problems.

arguments_against.label: Body Paragraph B - Disadvantages
phrases: One disadvantage of [topic] is that it...
A common problem is that [topic] can lead to...
Another issue is that [topic] may...
This is mainly because...
For instance, [example] shows that...
This can result in [negative result].

conclusion.label: Conclusion
conclusion.purpose: Summarise both sides and give a balanced final view
phrases: To sum up, [topic] has both advantages and disadvantages.
Overall, I believe the benefits of [topic] are greater than the drawbacks.
All in all, whether [topic] is a good idea depends on [condition/context].
On balance, [topic] can be useful, but it needs to be managed carefully.

problems_and_solutions.title: Problems & Solutions
problems_and_solutions.purpose: Describe key problems and suggest realistic solutions

introduction_context.label: Introduction - Problem Context
introduction_context.purpose: Introduce the issue and why it matters (1–2 sentences)
phrases: Nowadays, [problem] is becoming a serious issue in [place/area].
In recent years, more people have been affected by [problem].
Many people are concerned about [problem], especially because it affects [group].
It is clear that [problem] can have negative effects on [area].

thesis_statement.label: Thesis (What the essay will do)
thesis_statement.purpose: Say you will discuss problems and solutions
phrases: This essay will outline the main problems linked to [topic] and suggest possible solutions.
In the following paragraphs, I will explain the key difficulties and propose ways to improve the situation.
This essay will look at why [problem] happens and what can be done about it.

problems.label: Body Paragraph A - Problems
phrases: One major problem is that...
A second issue is that...
This happens because...
This means that [effect] becomes more likely.
As a result, [group] often ends up...

transition_to_solutions.label: Bridge (Move to solutions)
transition_to_solutions.purpose: Signal that you are now offering solutions
phrases: Fortunately, there are several ways to deal with this.
There are practical steps that could improve the situation.
Despite these difficulties, solutions do exist.

solutions.label: Body Paragraph B - Solutions
solutions.purpose: Give 2–3 solutions and explain why they would work
phrases: One possible solution would be to...
A practical step is to...
Schools/governments/companies could help by...
Another idea would be to introduce...
If this was implemented, it would lead to...
This would reduce [problem] because...

conclusion.label: Conclusion
conclusion.purpose: Summarise and end with a realistic final message
phrases: In conclusion, [problem] is serious, but it can be reduced with the right action.
To sum up, a combination of different measures would improve the situation.
Overall, if these steps are taken, [positive result] is likely.

cause_and_effect.title: Cause & Effect
cause_and_effect.purpose: Explain why something happens and what results it creates

introduction_context.label: Introduction - Situation Context
introduction_context.purpose: Introduce the phenomenon and show it matters (1–2 sentences)
phrases: In recent years, [phenomenon] has become much more common.
Nowadays, [phenomenon] affects many people in [place/area].
It seems that [phenomenon] is changing the way people [do something].

thesis_statement.label: Thesis (What you will analyse)
thesis_statement.purpose: Say you will explain causes and effects
phrases: This essay will explain the main causes of [phenomenon] and describe its effects.
In the following paragraphs, I will look at why [phenomenon] happens and what it leads to.
To understand [phenomenon], it is helpful to consider both its reasons and its consequences.

causes.label: Body Paragraph A - Causes
phrases: One key cause of [phenomenon] is...
This is often due to...
A major reason behind this is...
Another factor is that...
This is partly because...

transition_to_effects.label: Bridge (Move to effects)
phrases: Because of these reasons, [phenomenon] has several effects.
This situation leads to a number of consequences.
As a result, we can see changes in...

effects.label: Body Paragraph B - Effects
phrases: One major effect is that...
This can lead to...
As a consequence, [group] may...
Another outcome is...
Over time, this could result in...

conclusion.label: Conclusion
conclusion.purpose: Wrap up the relationship between causes and effects
phrases: To sum up, [phenomenon] is caused by several factors and has noticeable effects.
Overall, understanding the causes helps us deal with the consequences more effectively.
In conclusion, [phenomenon] is a complex issue with both clear reasons and real impacts.

agree_and_disagree.title: Agree & Disagree
agree_and_disagree.purpose: Consider both viewpoints and clearly state your position

introduction_context.label: Introduction - Debate Context
introduction_context.purpose: Introduce the statement and show it is debated (1–2 sentences)
phrases: Some people believe that [statement], while others disagree.
There is a lot of discussion about whether [statement] is true.
Opinions are divided on the idea that [statement].

thesis_statement.label: Thesis (Plan + position)
thesis_statement.purpose: Say you will consider both sides and give your view
phrases: This essay will discuss both sides before giving my opinion.
In the following paragraphs, I will consider arguments for and against this view and then state my position.
I will examine both perspectives and explain which one I find more convincing.

arguments_agree.label: Body Paragraph A - Reasons to Agree
phrases: People who agree often argue that...
One reason to support this view is that...
This is because...
For example, [example] shows that...

transition_to_disagree.label: Bridge (Move to the opposing view)
transition_to_disagree.purpose: Shift smoothly to the other side
phrases: However, there are also strong arguments against this idea.
On the other hand, many people believe that...
That said, it is worth considering the opposite viewpoint.

arguments_disagree.label: Body Paragraph B - Reasons to Disagree
phrases: Those who disagree point out that...
A strong counter-argument is that...
This may happen because...
For instance, [example] suggests that...

personal_opinion.label: Body Paragraph C - Your Opinion
personal_opinion.purpose: State your view clearly and justify it
phrases: In my opinion, I (agree/disagree) because...
Personally, I believe that... mainly because...
From my point of view, the strongest argument is...
Even though I understand the other side, I think that...

conclusion.label: Conclusion
phrases: To sum up, while both sides make valid points, I believe that...
Overall, I still think that [statement] is (true/false) because...
In conclusion, after considering both perspectives, my view is that...

opinion.title: Opinion Essay
opinion.purpose: Give a clear opinion and support it with strong reasons and examples

introduction_context.label: Introduction - Topic Context
phrases: Nowadays, [topic] is an important issue for many people.
In recent years, [topic] has become more common in everyday life.
Many people have different opinions about [topic].

thesis_statement.label: Thesis (Your opinion clearly)
thesis_statement.purpose: State your position directly but naturally
phrases: In my view, [opinion].
Personally, I believe that [opinion].
I think [opinion], for several reasons.
From my perspective, [opinion].

argument_1.label: Body Paragraph A - Strong reason
argument_1.purpose: Give your best reason + explain + example
phrases: Firstly, one key reason is that...
This matters because...
For example, [example] shows that...
As a result, [result].

argument_2.label: Body Paragraph B - Second reason
argument_2.purpose: Add another reason to strengthen your opinion
phrases: Secondly, another important point is that...
In addition, [topic] can...
Moreover, this helps because...
For instance, [example] demonstrates that...

counter_argument.label: Body Paragraph C - Counter-argument (Optional)
counter_argument.purpose: Mention the other side and respond to it
phrases: Some people might argue that...
It is true that... However, I believe that...
Although there are some disadvantages, I still think that...
Even if this is a concern, it can be solved by...

conclusion.label: Conclusion
phrases: In conclusion, I believe that [opinion] because of [reason 1] and [reason 2].
To sum up, my view is that [opinion].
Overall, I still think [opinion], and the reasons above support this.

speculation_and_trends.title: Trends & Predictions (Speculation / Generalisation)
speculation_and_trends.purpose: Describe a trend, explain why it is happening, and predict what may happen next

introduction_context.label: Introduction - Trend Context
introduction_context.purpose: Introduce the trend and show it is growing (1–2 sentences)
phrases: Nowadays, there is a growing trend towards [trend].
Over the past few years, [trend] has become much more common.
These days, it is normal to see people [trend/action].

thesis_statement.label: Thesis (What you will cover)
thesis_statement.purpose: Say you will discuss reasons and future
phrases: This essay will explain why this trend is happening and what it could lead to in the future.
In the following paragraphs, I will discuss the causes of this trend and make predictions about what may happen next.
To understand this trend, it is useful to look at its reasons and its likely future effects.

current_trends_causes.label: Body Paragraph A - Current trend + causes
current_trends_causes.purpose: Describe what is happening now and why
phrases: At the moment, [trend] is popular because...
This change is mainly due to...
One reason for this is that...
Another factor is that...
For example, [example] shows how [cause] encourages [trend].

transition_to_future.label: Bridge (Move to the future)
phrases: Looking ahead, this trend may develop even further.
If this continues, we might see...
In the future, it is likely that...

future_predictions.label: Body Paragraph B - Predictions
future_predictions.purpose: Make realistic predictions and explain consequences
phrases: It is likely that [trend] will become even more widespread.
If current patterns continue, [future result] may happen.
This could lead to [effect], especially for [group].
On the other hand, it might also cause [challenge].
Overall, the long-term impact could be...

conclusion.label: Conclusion
phrases: To sum up, [trend] is increasing because of [causes], and it will probably continue.
Overall, this trend is likely to shape [area] in the future.
In conclusion, [trend] seems set to grow, although its effects will depend on [condition].
